news_header: Humanity is increasingly vulnerable to solar storms, with significant implications for technology and communication.
news_text: Research Director Antti Pulkkinen highlights the current peak of solar activity, which poses risks to telecommunications and electrical systems on Earth. Solar storms can disrupt satellite operations and even cause widespread electrical failures, as seen during the May 2022 storm. Pulkkinen emphasizes the need for better preparedness in the face of these events, drawing parallels between space weather and traditional weather patterns. He shares his journey from Finland to NASA, where he continues to study the effects of solar activity on technology.
